Psychology_407_r$Psychology_142_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Two more experiments indicated that the angle of the eyebrows drove this effect -- downward-tilted heads had eyebrows that appeared to take more of a V shape, even though the eyebrows had not moved from a neutral position, and this was associated with perceptions of dominance.
Finding B: Self-efficacy and support The result: support from their partners is helpful to smokers who wish to stop and it increases their chances of success, provided that they have developed skills of their own that help them to abstain.
Finding C: The group that had been asleep were better at remembering the German translations of the Dutch words they had heard in their sleep.
Finding D: Childhood Corporal #Punishment and Future Perpetration of Physical Dating Violence [a] HT @username #DV #IPV #VAW #Parenting

Finding A: Openness to experience was associated with lower neighborhood income and employment rate, lower voting activity, higher crime rates, and higher proportion of people receiving income and disability support, whereas the reverse correlations with these neighborhood characteristics were observed for life satisfaction.
Finding B: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).
Finding C: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding D: Food addiction prevalence appeared to be further elevated when PTSD symptoms occurred earlier in life.

Psychology_112_r$Psychology_169_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: While anyone whoas experienced the difficulty of depression or insomnia may not be surprised that theyare connected, this study marks the first time scientists can definitively say there are neural mechanisms underlying the relationship between the two.
Finding B: The findings suggest that music instruction helps enhance skills that are critical for academic success.
Finding C: This research could lead to better sleep quality for people with depression, and opens up the possibility of new targeted treatments.
Finding D: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
